result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Kurtis W Berberich in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Kurtis W Berberich.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Wang states the defendant has not gotten to look thru all of the discovery yet and asks to adjourn for 30-45 days.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:45 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kurtis W Berberich in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Kurtis W Berberich.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wang provides an update, she sent discovery materials to the defendant in the jail but there was some misunderstanding so her client has not been able to view all of the discovery.  Atty. Wang requests another further proceedings in about 60 days.  State has no objection and notes their office has complied with victim rights to proceed with the hearing today.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:19 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kurtis W Berberich in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Angela Wang.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wang provides an update, she is requesting another further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the Defendant asking to have the no contact order with his parents be modified.
Affidavit of Service
Protective Order signed by Judge Laura Lau 06/09/2022.

11:14 AM; Case called for Motion hearing.  Defendant Kurtis W Berberich in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Angela Wang.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on the State's Motion for Protective Order.  Atty. Jay presents statements and notes defense has no objection to the request for a protective order for Victims A & B, but are objecting with respect to Victim C.  Atty. Jay presents additional statements and is asking the Court to grant the motion for protective order as to Victims A, B & C.  Atty. Wang advises her client has no objection to the protective order as to all victims.  Based on there being no objection the Court will grant the State's Motion and grants a Protective Order as to Victims A, B & C listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Court notes there is already a further proceedings date set for 7/18/2022 at 9:00 a.m.  Counsel confirm that date and time will still work.  Court will maintain the previously set hearing on 07/18/2022 at 9:00 a.m.

10:32 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kurtis W Berberich in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wang provides an update, she has received all discovery and has a meeting with the ADA assigned to the case tomorrow with a follow-up in July.  Atty. Wang is requesting a further proceedings date in July.  No comment from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Kurtis W Berberich in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with the individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 5 miles of Victims A & B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.

10:00 AM Defendant Kurtis W Berberich appeared by phone, in custody at Waukesha County Jail, with attorney Angela Wang.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
